articles.title: Phishing with SQL
articles.description: Welcome to the website. I hope you enjoy it!
articles.contents: We started with fake news, only to end up at phishing. That’s just how the world works! Taking raw data from this dataset, I’m attempting to explore the URLs of phishing websites! Taking a look at the raw data: DISPLAY RAW DATA - grab a first 4 columns + phishing column (move phsidhing column tot he front) phishingpie <- data %>% select(phishing) %>% group_by(phishing) %>% summarise(occurances = n()) %>% mutate(phishing = recode(phishing, '1'='Phishing link', '0'="Non-phishing link")) phishingagg <- plot_ly(phishingpie, labels = ~phishing, values = ~occurances, type = 'pie',marker = list(colors = c('MidnightBlue', 'MediumPurple')), textposition = 'inside', textinfo = 'label+percent', insidetextfont = list(color = '#FFFFFF'), hoverinfo = 'text', text = ~paste(occurances, 'links')) %>% layout(title="Phishing V.S. Non-Phishing Links", legend = list(x = 100, y = 0.5, title=list(text=' Types of Websites '))) phishingagg make the links open to a blank page can you display just this as something general talk about teh data -> how many were fishing? how many weren’t? -> pie chart correlation - build tables (take the head of x) - explain the pearson correlation, how can we get info out - cast bigint and basically couldn twork, so had to build a table (you can build it using R) create table url length - out of phishing, plot density graph, –> url lenght vs amount of urls -> phishing vs no phishing same thing with redirections end this shoudl be pretty quick and simple it hink https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1JNzGqUo9HEn5WOKftEgcm94JddOK6G3_QW-UI4sFNUY/edit#gid=0 https://docs.google.com/document/d/1M9kvGEJ1_db81M5g6J8DtF0kAFnCCAPlnuUMzAmVUOA/edit
